titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Roy Pateman papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Issayas Tesfamariam

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-09-15T14:39-0700

change.item: Revised to add complete container list from Issayas.

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, printed matter, photographs, videorecordings, and sound recordings relating mainly to political conditions in Eritrea and the history of Eritrea.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Roy Pateman papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2016.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Roy Pateman, a British political scientist, was born in England on August 15, 1935. After receiving his Bachelor of Science from the University of Nottingham in 1958, he continued his graduate studies at London and Reading Universities, graduating in 1967 and 1971, respectively. He was also a counter-intelligence operative of the British Army in Kenya and the United Kingdom from 1958 to 1965.

Pateman is Professor Emeritus of Political Science at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), after many years of teaching, research, and administrative experience at Princeton University; University of Sydney, Australia; University of California, Los Angeles; the Hoover Institution; and the University of Asmara, Eritrea.

Pateman spent twenty-five years working voluntarily for the Eritrean Relief Association (ERA) in Australia, Sweden, the US, the UK, Eritrea, and Sudan. He also has considerable experience working with the media, television, and radio broadcasting in the United States, Great Britain, Australia, and Eritrea.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Roy Pateman papers document forty-seven years of Pateman's professional career, from 1954 through 2016. The collection includes correspondence, notes, reports, pamphlets, transcriptions of radio broadcasts relating to Africa, syllabi, other printed matter, photographs, videorecordings, and sound recordings relating mainly to political conditions in Eritrea and the history of Eritrea.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains Pateman's curriculum vitae.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List of materials donated to the Hoover Institution.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sound recordings include two-sided tapes capturing Roy Pateman's work in Eritrea.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Airport sounds and arrival in Acropole Hotel, Dubai. In Arabic and English.
Interview in Khartoum with Issayas Afeworki, Vice Secretary General of the Eritrean Peopleâs Liberation Front, on general principles and policy.
Interview with Gebre Michael Mengistu, Secretary of the Eritrean Relief Association.
Eritrean Relief Association clinic in Port Sudan.
Tour with Negussie, medical director, and Fassic of the Eritrean Relief Association clinic in Khartoum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Land cruiser sounds to Suakin.
Boat building and workshops in Suakin.
Eritrean Relief Association garage in Suakin, and Mereit base area and guest house.
Commentary on base area trip to Nacfa.
Interview with villagers at a displaced peoples camp.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interviews in English, Tigrinya and Tigre with people from Afabet, including commentary by Mama Zenab at Nacfa guest house.
Battalion Office, Nacfa.
Office in Krar, playing and singing.
Radio from Addis.
Tour of front line trenches and sounds of gunfire.
Interview with female fighter.
Concert and drinking.
Interview at the Mosque with Dr. Andom, Agricultural Specialist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Trip to Orotta with an introduction to the programme.
Interview in Himbol with Yonas, field coordinator for the Eritrean Relief Association.
General comments.
Zero School, English language lesson workshops, with Berkai, director of Zero School.
Continuation of school interview with Askalu Menkerios.
Tour of the hospital with Dr. Nerayo.
Displaced persons camp, orphanage, and commentary on POWs.
Truckies camp on the banks of the River Barka.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clinic at Port Sudan, with commentary on the repatriation of refugees.
Commentary on briefing with the first secretary of the British Embassy at Khartoum.
Tape does not include a side B.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Daily journal, Port Sudan and Orotta.
Second Eritrean Medical Congress speeches.
Dr. Asafa and foreign guests.
Four songs by Red Flowers at the cultural evening.
Commentary by Ove Engevik.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: French TV crew, Barka River.
Tessenai.
Ali Ghidir irrigation plantation, Mahari.
Work songs, Girmaica.
Journal entry.
Talk with displaced people from the highlands returning home.
Interview with wounded Ethiopian captain, a POW.
Arrival in Barentu.
Interview with defectors from Dergue militia.
Return to Port Sudan.
Khartoum, journal aid workers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Side A: Travel diary from Acropole Hotel, Khartoum.
Side B: Diary from Port Sudan, Orotta-Massawa, and Adi Keih.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Adi Keih diary.
Sabah Fessehaie, female prisoner for three years.
Interview with a Lutheran World Services storeman. In English.
Interviews with Gebre Gerassus and Gerazi Wolde Sellassie, a recent defector from Asmara. In English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Continued interview with Gerzai Wolde Selassie.
Interview with Goitom Gebre Hiwet, a merchant and former prisoner of the Dergue.
Diary.
Tape does not include a side B.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Diary at Senafe.
Axum ruins, church, and peasants.
Interview with Blatta Mohamed Omer (aged 80), former Muslim League MP in Eritrean Parliament. In English and Tigrinya.
Continuation of Blatta Mohamed Omer interview.

Interview with Graznamach Salah Mohammed (aged 72), former Muslim League MP in Eritrean Parliament and present on November 14, 1962 when the Governor dissolved the Eritrean Parliament. In English and Tigrinya.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Diary in Senafe.
Interview in Senafe with Osman, Central Committee member of Eritean People's Liberation Front.
Interview with Graznamamch Wolde Lassus (aged 87). In English and Tigrinya.
Continued interview with Lassus.
Interview in Adi Keih with Capuchin Father Tessay and Gebre Abraham. In English.
Diary in Massawa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Side A: Interview with Issayas and Richard Leonard. In English.
Side B: Conclusion of interview.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: All audio cassettes were recorded in September of 1991 but there is no specific date provided for each tape.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This set of audio cassettes contains the daily description of events during the independence referendum vote held between April 21 and 23, 1993.
